children.name: sandwich
children.definition: two pieces of bread, sometimes spread with butter ormargarine, and with some other usually cold food between them : bánh xăng-uýt
examples: a tuna/ ham/ toasted sandwich
a sandwich bar/box
sandwich fillings
jam sandwichtwo pieces of bread with jam between them, or a type of cake made in two parts with jam spread between
open sandwich[a single slice of bread with various types of food, such as cold fish or meat, on the top : bánh xăng-uýt trần
submarine sandwich(informalsub) US a long thin loaf of bread filled with salad and cold meat or cheese : bánh mì dài bổ theo chiều nhồi nhân
double-decker (sandwich)a sandwich made with three pieces of bread with food such as cold meat or cheese between them : bánh có hai lớp nhân
club sandwicha sandwich made from three pieces of bread with meat, egg, cheese, salad or other cold food between them : bánh mì xăng-uýt kẹp thịt và gia vị chua

children.name: chip
children.definition: UKFrench fryUS  a long thin piece of potato that is fried and usually eaten hot : khoai tây chiên (dạng thỏi)
examples: beans/egg/sausage and chips
oven chips (= chips that are baked in a cooker)
fish and chips
abag of chips

children.name: snack
children.definition: a small amount of food that is eaten between meals
examples: Drinks andlight snacksare served at the bar.
snack foodslike crisps and peanuts
Many snackfoodsare high in salt, sugar and fat.
I had a huge lunch, so I'll only need a snack for dinner.

children.name: crisp
children.definition: UK (potato)chipUS) A2 a very thin, often round piece of fried potato, sometimes with a flavour added, and sold especially in plastic bags : khoai tây rán, khoai tây chiên (dạng mỏng giòn)
examples: a packet ofsalt and vinegar crisps
a bag of chips

children.name: popcorn
children.definition: seeds of maize that are heated until they break open and become soft and light, usually flavoured with salt, butter or sugar : bỏng ngô, ngô rang nở
examples: a tub of popcorn

children.name: bun
children.definition: a small, sweet, usually round cake : bánh bao nhân nho; bánh sữa nhỏ
examples: a currant bun
a sticky bun

children.name: cake
children.definition: a soft sweet food made by baking a mixture of flour, butter, sugar, and eggs :
examples: We had cake and ice cream.
a chocolate cake
make/bake a cakeLet's make a cake for his birthday.
decorate a cakeWe decorated the cake with strawberries and cream.
ice a cakeBritish English,frost a cakeAmerican English(= cover a cake with fine sugar mixed with a liquid )She iced her own wedding cake.
a piece/slice of cakeWould you like a slice of cake?
a cake recipeDo you have any good cake recipes?
a cake tinBritish English,a cake panAmerican English(= that you bake a cake in )Use a 20 cm cake tin.
a cake shopThere's a very good cake shop in the market.
cake mix(= a mixture that you buy in a packet and use for making a cake )If I'm feeling lazy, I sometimes use a cake mix.
types of cake
a birthday/Christmas/wedding cake(= a special cake for a birthday etc )Lucy had twelve candles on her birthday cake.
a home-made cakeHome-made cakes are much nicer than bought ones.
a fruit cake(= one with dried fruit in it )Fruit cakes keep for quite a long time.
a sponge cake(= one made from flour, butter, sugar, and eggs )It's best to eat sponge cakes on the day you make them.
a chocolate/lemon etc cake(= a sponge cake with a chocolate etc flavour )She'd baked a chocolate cake for me.
a cream cake(= one with thick cream inside it )I'll get fat if I eat any more cream cakes.
COMMON ERRORS
►Do not say 'cook a cake'. Saymake a cakeorbake a cake.

children.name: sandwich
children.definition: / sandwich cakeUK  a cake consisting of two layers with jam and cream between them :
examples: a jam and cream sandwich
a Victoria sandwich
a raspberry sponge sandwich

children.name: pastry
children.definition: C1 a mixture of flour, butter, and milk or water, used to make the outer part of baked foods such as pies : bột nhão
examples: shortcrust/ puff/ filo/ choux/ flaky pastry
Ann makes delicious pastry - you should try her apple pie.
choux pastry[ U ] a type of pastry made with eggs, which when cooked forms a hollow case for filling with cream or other thick liquids
puff pastry[ U ] pastry with a lot of thin layers which swells to a larger size when cooked
shortcrust (pastry)[ U ] a type of soft pastry which breaks easily
filo (pastry)UK/phyllo (pastry)US [U ] a type of pastry made in thin, almost transparent layers
pastry[C] C1 a type of sweet cake made of special pastry and usually containing something such as fruit or nuts : bánh ngọt
We were offered a selection of cakes and pastries with our tea.
a Danish pastry
Cornish pasty[ C ] UK a piece of pastry baked with a mixture of meat and vegetables inside it, usually for one person to eat bánh pa-tê làm bằng bột nhồi thịt và rau
Danish pastry[ C ] (USDanish) a type of cake for one person, consisting of sweet pastry, often with fruit inside : bánh trộn táo và hạnh nhân phết kem

children.name: croissant
children.definition: a piece of light crescent -shaped pastry, usually eaten in the morning : bánh sừng bò

children.name: pie
children.definition: a type of food made with meat, vegetables or fruit covered in pastry and baked : bánh nướng
examples: Would you like some more pork pie?
a pecan pie
slice/piece of pie
Would you like another piece of apple pie?
banoffee pie/ banoffi piea sweet dish made from bananas , cream and toffee on pastry
pork pie[ C ] mainly UK a small round pastry case filled with cooked pork, eaten cold
mince pie[ C ] a covered pastry case filled with mincemeat

children.name: flan
children.definition: UK a case of pastry or cake without a top, which contains fruit or something savoury such as cheese
examples: a cheese and onion flan
a pear flan
a flan dish

children.name: samosa
children.definition: a small triangular pastry case filled with vegetables or meat and spices and fried, eaten in South Asia : bánh rán (hình tam giác)

children.name: sausage roll
children.definition: UK a tube of pastry filled with sausage meat : xúc xích bao bột

children.name: pancake
children.definition: a very thin flat round made from a mixture of flour, milk and egg, which is fried on both sides and is eaten hot
examples: Do you want a sweet pancake or a savoury one?
crepe/ crêpe[C] mainly US a very thin pancake : bánh kếp

children.name: spring roll
children.definition: / pancake rollUK/egg rollUS  a savoury Chinese pancake which is rolled up, filled with small pieces of vegetables and sometimes meat and fried : nem rán, chả giò chiên

children.name: waffle
children.definition: a flat cake, marked with a pattern of deep squares,eaten especially in the US and Canada : bánh quế

children.name: batter
children.definition: a mixture of flour, eggs and milk, used to make pancakes or to cover food before frying it :bột nhão(làm bánhkếp hay bọc thức ăn chiên)
examples: fishinbatter

children.name: biscuit
children.definition: UKcookieUS A2  a small, flat cakethat is dry and usually sweet : bánh quy
examples: chocolate/ ginger biscuits
cheese and biscuits
a glass of milk and a cookie
a chocolate chip cookie
a packet of biscuits
a packet of chocolate biscuits
tead and biscuits
We hadtea andbiscuits at 3.30 p.m.

children.name: cracker
children.definition: a thin flat crisp biscuit, especially one eaten with cheese: bánh quy mỏng giòn

children.name: crumb
children.definition: a very small piece of bread, cake or biscuit: vụn bánh
examples: There were just a few crumbs left on the plate.
She stood up to brush the crumbs off her uniform.
Coat withbread crumbsand bake.

children.name: breadcrumbs
children.definition: very small pieces of bread that are left after cutting bread, or are used in cooking : vụn bánh mì
examples: Coat the fish in breadcrumbs and fry.

children.name: heel
children.definition: the end part of sth, especially of a loaf of bread, that is usually left after the rest has been eaten or used : cùi bánh mì

children.name: crust
children.definition: the outside layer of a loaf of bread : vỏ bánh
examples: Could you cut the crusts off the sandwiches, please?
sandwiches with the crusts cut off

children.name: bread
children.definition: a type of food made from flour and water that is mixed together and then baked :
examples: Would you like some bread with your soup?
a loaf of brown bread
a piece of bread and butter
freshEat the bread while it’s nice and fresh.
stale(= hard and no longer fresh )This bread’s stale – shall I throw it away?
crusty(= having a hard crust that is nice to eat )Serve the soup with crusty bread.
mouldyBritish English,moldyAmerican English(= covered with a green substance that grows on old food )All there was in the house was a loaf of mouldy old bread.
white/brown breadWould you like white bread or brown bread?
wholewheat bread(alsowholemeal breadBritish English) (= bread made with flour that contains all of the grain )Wholemeal bread is good for you.
home-made/home-baked breadI love home-made bread.
a slice/piece of breadCan I have another slice of bread?
a loaf of breadHe’s gone to buy a loaf of bread.
a chunk of bread(= a piece that you pull off a loaf instead of cutting it )He tore off a chunk of bread and dipped it in the sauce.
make/bake breadWe usually make our own bread.
cut/slice breadCould you cut some bread?

children.name: bun
children.definition: mainly US a small round piece of bread, especially one which is cut horizontally and holds a burger : bánh mì tròn
examples: a hamburger bun

children.name: toast
children.definition: bread that has been heated so that it is brown on both sides and no longer soft : bánh mì mới nướng
examples: I had apiece of toastfor breakfast.
aslice oftoast
I have toastandmarmalade for breakfast.
I'm having beansontoast for supper.

children.name: roll
children.definition: / bread roll a small round loaf of bread for one person : ổ bánh mì nhỏ
examples: hot soup served with crusty rolls
bread rollswith butter
Would you like a roll and butter with your soup?
ham/cheese etc rollUK(= one that is filled with ham, cheese etc )
UKI bought a cheese roll ( US cheese on a roll) (= a small piece of bread filled with cheese) for lunch.

children.name: loaf
children.definition: bread that is shaped and baked in one piece and can be cut into slices : ổ
examples: aloaf of bread
two loaves of white bread
white/wholemeal/granary etc loafBritish English
a sliced loafBritish English

children.name: baguette
children.definition: (French stickUK) a long thin white stick of bread, of a type which originally came from France : bánh mì gậy
examples: a ham and cheese baguette

children.name: bagel
children.definition: a small, hard roll of bread in the shape of a ring : bánh mì vòng
examples: an onion bagel

children.name: breadstick
children.definition: a long thin stick of bread which is crisp (= hard enough to break) like a biscuit : bánh mì que

children.name: muffin
children.definition: UKEnglish muffinUS  a small round flat type of bread, usually sliced in two and eaten hot with butter : bánh nướng xốp
